skill.name: binary-re:synthesis
skill.description: Use when ready to document findings, generate a report, or summarize binary analysis results. Compiles analysis findings into structured reports - correlates facts from triage/static/dynamic phases, validates hypotheses, generates documentation with evidence chains. Keywords - "summarize findings", "generate report", "document analysis", "what did we find", "write up results", "export findings"
skill.summary: Use when ready to document findings, generate a report, or summarize binary analysis results. Compil...
skill.author: 2389-research

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only markdown methodology and templates. No executable code, no file system access, no network operations. Contains no code execution paths. Safe for publication.

content.user_title: Synthesize binary analysis findings into structured reports
content.value_statement: Binary reverse engineering produces scattered facts and hypotheses that are difficult to organize and present. This skill provides systematic synthesis methodology to compile findings into confidence-calibrated reports with traceable evidence chains for stakeholders.
actual_capabilities: Correlate facts from triage, static, and dynamic analysis phases
Validate hypotheses against collected evidence with confidence scoring
Generate structured markdown reports with executive summaries
Document binary capabilities including network, filesystem, and crypto features
Create evidence-indexed conclusions for stakeholder handoff
Export findings in JSON and STIX/TAXII formats for threat intelligence sharing
limitations: Does not perform actual binary analysis - requires findings from other phases
Does not execute or interact with binaries directly
Templates require human completion with specific analysis data
Quality of output depends on completeness of preceding analysis phases

use_cases.title: Document malware analysis
use_cases.description: Compile IoT malware findings into shareable reports for security teams and threat intelligence platforms.

use_cases.title: Summarize firmware analysis
use_cases.description: Document binary capabilities for firmware security review and vulnerability assessment reporting.

use_cases.title: Create IOC reports
use_cases.description: Generate structured indicators of compromise from binary analysis for incident documentation and sharing.

prompt_templates.title: Basic synthesis request
prompt_templates.scenario: Beginner user wanting to summarize findings
prompt_templates.prompt: We have completed analysis of [binary name]. Please synthesize our findings into a report that includes: what the binary does, its key capabilities, evidence supporting our conclusions, and any remaining unknowns.

prompt_templates.title: Stakeholder report
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a binary analysis report for non-technical stakeholders. Focus on: executive summary, business risk assessment, and actionable recommendations. Technical details should be in appendices.

prompt_templates.title: Threat intelligence export
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a STIX-compliant export of our binary analysis findings including malware type, capabilities, and external indicators like network destinations and file system paths.

prompt_templates.title: Multi-phase correlation
prompt_templates.prompt: Correlate our triage findings ([arch], [dependencies]), static analysis (functions at [addresses], strings [list]), and dynamic analysis (syscalls observed: [list]). Validate the hypothesis that [hypothesis statement] with confidence score.

output_examples.input: Please summarize our analysis of the thermostat daemon binary. We found it is an ARM binary that connects to api.thermco.com:443 every 30 seconds to report temperature data.
output: â€¢ Purpose: IoT telemetry client reporting temperature/humidity to vendor cloud
â€¢ Confidence: HIGH (confirmed by URL strings, curl imports, and dynamic observation)
â€¢ Key Capabilities: HTTPS client, config file parsing, logging
â€¢ Network Behavior: Connects to api.thermco.com:443 every 30 seconds
â€¢ Security Notes: No certificate pinning detected; config may contain API credentials
â€¢ Evidence: 23 facts recorded, 2/3 hypotheses confirmed

best_practices: Complete triage, static, and dynamic analysis phases before synthesis to ensure comprehensive evidence
Assign confidence levels based on evidence strength and explicitly document contradicting evidence
Record synthesis output to episodic memory for cross-session continuity and future reference
anti_patterns: Attempting synthesis without completing prior analysis phases - leads to speculation instead of evidence-based conclusions
Presenting hypotheses as facts without explicit confidence calibration and evidence citations
Failing to document remaining unknowns - unacknowledged gaps create false confidence

faq.question: Does this skill analyze binaries directly?
faq.answer: No. This skill synthesizes findings from binary-re:triage, binary-re:static-analysis, and binary-re:dynamic-analysis. Run those phases first.

faq.question: What confidence levels are used?
faq.answer: High means multiple independent sources confirm; Medium means some evidence with no contradictions; Low means limited evidence; Speculative is pattern-based guess.

faq.question: Can I export findings for threat intelligence sharing?
faq.answer: Yes. Output formats include JSON for tools/databases and STIX/TAXII for threat intelligence platforms and incident response.

faq.question: How does this integrate with other binary-re skills?
faq.answer: It reads episodic memory from previous phases and writes synthesis conclusions back for cross-session persistence.

faq.question: What if I have conflicting evidence?
faq.answer: Document both supporting and contradicting evidence. Mark hypotheses as Uncertain and explain the conflict in the report.

faq.question: How is this different from standard documentation?
faq.answer: It enforces evidence-based methodology with confidence calibration, hypothesis tracking, and structured evidence chains for reproducibility.
